Subjective: Right eye redness and irritation since Tuesday morning; feels like hair or dust in eye; pain when squeezing eyes shut; left eye starting to show redness; no vision problems or light sensitivity; no flu-like symptoms. Request: Wants to know if normal eye infection or something else; concerned about worsening or contagion; asks if needs eye drops or antibiotics.
Objective: Right eye: redness and inflammation of surface layer; left eye: starting to show redness; pupils reacting normally to light; no unusual findings on eyelids or bottom of eyes.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis in right eye, left eye possibly starting to be infected as well. No signs of bacterial infection or other complications.
Plan: 2. Use artificial tears from pharmacy for soothing, as needed
3. Clean eyes with lukewarm tap water and cotton pad in the morning if sticky
4. Follow up if not improved after 2 weeks or if pain, pus, or vision changes occur
5. No antibiotics or specific treatment needed at this time
